channel.title: Messengers in wiki
channel.description:
I studied all popular secure messengers and found that only Simplex provides not only high anonymity but also high protection (encrypted local storage and self-destruct passcode). This is great for Kicksecure. I think you can copy this page to the Kicksecure wiki https://www.whonix.org/wiki/SimpleX and add Simplex and Session https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/Session to section of recommended messengers https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/Software#Instant_Messengers
Or I can add links to the websites of these messengers in the wiki: [https://simplex.chat/ SimpleX] [https://getsession.org/ Session] and maybe: [https://docs.cwtch.im/ Cwtch] ## XMPP/Jabber Client [https://dino.im/ Dino IM] [https://gajim.org/ Gajim]

item.title: Messengers in wiki
item.dc:creator: sam
item.description:
The page about messengers on the Whonix wiki is amazing! I decided to try and change the Kicksecure wiki. I think Cwtch is not suitable for Kicksecure. Kicksecure is an OS for the clearnet and for security. Cwtch only works in Tor and does not have special security features, unlike Simplex. I think Simplex is perfectly suited for Kicksecure at the moment. And maybe XMPP clients. I tried to copy sections from the Whonix wiki to the Kicksecure wiki. I don‚Äôt know if I did it right. Check it please. Sorry, if I did something wrong

Read full topic

item.title: Messengers in wiki
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Related recent lengthy discussion:

Whonix Forum ‚Äì 7 May 25

Recommended private chats and social networks for Whonix

Support

Patrick, I‚Äôve noticed an issue with beginners and less experienced users: they either don‚Äôt know where to communicate safely, or they install messengers with built-in Tor, resulting in Tor over Tor. Essentially, Whonix is best suited for anonymous...

Reading time: 10 mins üïë Likes: 41 ‚ù§

Read full topic

item.title: Messengers in wiki
item.dc:creator: sam
item.description:
Wow, it is very interesting. I read his recent articles from 2024-2025, and he also does not recommend XMPP due to weak cryptography and outdated versions of OMEMO Against XMPP+OMEMO - Dhole Moments He writes that Cwtch has not undergone any security audits. He recommends only Signal and Simplex Chat, but he acknowledges the issue of the phone number in Signal. It seems that Simplex is currently the only messenger that does not have account registration issues, encryption problems, works with Tor and the clearnet, and has powerful security features.

Read full topic

item.title: Messengers in wiki
item.dc:creator: arraybolt3
item.description:
Session was given an informal security audit and did very, very poorly. The same cryptographer that did this initial investigation then wrote a followup pointing out some more problems. This same cryptographer also discovered CVEs in Matrix‚Äôs encryption, so I think they likely know what they‚Äôre doing.

I‚Äôve done quite a bit of research into SimpleX (I actually wrote some of the content that‚Äôs now in the page you linked to), and its cryptography has been security-audited with relatively positive results, so I‚Äôm pretty hopeful for it.

Read full topic

I studied all popular secure messengers and found that only Simplex provides not only high anonymity but also high protection (encrypted local storage and self-destruct passcode).
